intro: Kalakia stenocarpa f. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-fruited kalakia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is smooth and elliptical, distinguishing it from other varieties in the species. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
